3 Exponentiation
Rules

\(a^m a^n = a^{m+n}\)
\(\frac{a^m}{a^n} = a^{m-n}\)
\((a^m)^n = a^{mn}\)
\(a^n b^n = (ab)^n\)
\(\frac{a^n}{b^n} = \left(\frac{a}{b}\right)^n\)

Special cases

\(a^1 = a\)
\(a^0 = 1, \quad a \neq 0\)
\(aa^n = a^{n+1}\)
\(1^n = 1\)
\(0^n = 0, \quad n > 0\)
\(a^{-n} = \frac{1}{a^n}\)

title: 1  Math Basics
text:
4 Logarithm
\(y = \log_ax \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad a^y = x\)
Rules

\(\log(uv) = \log u + \log v\)
\(\log\left(\frac{u}{v}\right) = \log u - \log v\)
\(\log\left(\frac{1}{v}\right) = -\log v\)
\(\log(u^r) = r \log u\)

Change of base
\(\log_a x = \frac{\log_b x}{\log_b a}\)

Laws of set theory

Commutative Laws

\(A \cup B = B \cup A\)
\(A \cap B = B \cap A\)

Associative Laws

\((A \cup B) \cup C = A \cup (B \cup C)\)
\((A \cap B) \cap C = A \cap (B \cap C)\)

Distributive Laws

\((A \cup B) \cap C = (A \cap C) \cup (B \cap C)\)
\((A \cap B) \cup C = (A \cup C) \cap (B \cup C)\)

De Morgan’s laws

\((A \cap B)^\complement = A^\complement \cup B^\complement\)
\((A \cup B)^\complement = A^\complement \cap B^\complement\)


Terms

Disjoint

\(A\) and \(B\) are called disjoint if \(A \cap B = \emptyset\)

8 Inequalities
Inequalities can be transformed by applying any monotonic transformation \(f(x)\) to both sides of the inequality. The inequality symbol has to be reversed if the function \(f(x)\) is monotonically decreasing. Details Wikipedia

monotonically increasing

Multiply by positive factor
Add/subtract number (\(f(x) = x + a\))
\(f(x) = \exp(x)\), \(f(x) = \log(x)\), …

monotonically decreasing

Multiply by negative factor
\(f(x) = x^{-1}\), …
